result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl E. Wardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Any contact with A.D.T., DOB: 04-27-1992; must be approved by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

supervisions.notes:
Under the Huber Law. 

Commencing forthwith. 

Time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DOC Balance Inquiry

11:40 AM Defendant Carl E. Wardman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Carl E. Wardman.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reviewed the revocation paperwork and there are no additions or corrections. 
Defendant's probation has been revoked effective 09-30-2022.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
The defendant has credit for 66 days which is time served. 
The Court orders a judgment for any unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Nathan Heim, Public Defender.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea date on June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea date on April 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:08 PM Defendant Carl E. Wardman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared by video for Carl E. Wardman, Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement: Letter from February 9, 2022.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Plea date scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea date on April 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:27 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Carl E. Wardman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared in court for Carl E. Wardman. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. The parties have a stipulation to amend the condition of bail to no assaultive or abusive contact with the victim.  The victim is in agreement with the amendment.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Carl E. Wardman appeared by video, Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Carl E. Wardman. 
Attorney Kneple was just appointed through the Public Defender, Attorney Harrison appearing specially.  Defense requests this matter be set out to the Monday felony initial appearances.  
Initial appearance reset to 02-07-2022 at 1:30pm in Branch 2.
Initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Carl Knepel, Public Defender.

ADDRESS INFO for Carl E. Wardman
Current: 6404 Hwy 22, Lena, WI 54139 United States  (Effective: 01-25-2022)
Prior: 1816 19Th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Disorderly conduct (DVO) repeater, on 01-06-22.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct (DVO).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-27-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with A.D.T., DOB: 04-27-92 and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 48 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
